dublinCore.dc:title: 119 HR 2236 IH: Healthy Foods for Native Seniors Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Vasquez introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Agriculture

form.official-title: To direct the Secretary of Agriculture to carry out a demonstration project to allow Tribal entities to purchase agricultural commodities under the commodity supplemental food program, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Healthy Foods for Native Seniors Act.

section.header: Commodity supplemental food program demonstration project for Tribal organizations

subparagraph.text: The term demonstration project means the demonstration project established under paragraph (2).
The term food distribution program means the commodity supplemental food program under section 4 of the Agriculture and Consumer Protection Act of 1973 (7 U.S.C. 612c note).
The term Indian reservation has the meaning given the term reservation in section 3 of the Food and Nutrition Act of 2008 (7 U.S.C. 2012).
The term Indian Tribe has the meaning given such term in section 4 of the Indian Self-Determination and Education Assistance Act (25 U.S.C. 5304).
The term Secretary means the Secretary of Agriculture.

The term self-determination contract has the meaning given such term in section 4 of the Indian Self-Determination and Education Assistance Act (25 U.S.C. 5304) with modification as determined by the Secretary.
The term Tribal organization has the meaning given such term in section 3 of the Food and Nutrition Act of 2008 (7 U.S.C. 2012).

paragraph.text: Subject to the availability of appropriations, the Secretary shall establish a demonstration project under which 1 or more Tribal entities may enter into self-determination contracts to purchase agricultural commodities under the food distribution program for the Indian reservation of that Tribal entity.

subparagraph.text: The Secretary shall consult with Tribal entities to determine the process under which each entity may participate in the demonstration project.
The Secretary shall select for participation in the demonstration project Tribal entities that—

clause.text: are successfully administering the food distribution program of the Tribal entity;
have the capacity to purchase agricultural commodities in accordance with paragraph (4) for the food distribution program of the Tribal entity; and
meet any other criteria determined by the Secretary, in consultation with the Secretary of the Interior and Tribal entities.

paragraph.text: Any agricultural commodities purchased by a Tribal entity under the demonstration project shall—

subparagraph.text: not result in a material increase in the amount of food in the food package of that Tribal entity compared to the amount of food that the Secretary authorized to be provided through the CSFP Guide Rate;

be of similar or higher nutritional value as the type of agricultural commodities that would be supplanted in the existing food package for that Tribal entity or be an agricultural commodity with Tribal significance to that Tribal entity; and
meet any other criteria determined by the Secretary.

paragraph.text: Not later than 1 year after the date on which funds are appropriated under paragraph (6), and annually thereafter, the Secretary shall submit to the Committee on Agriculture of the House of Representatives and the Committee on Agriculture, Nutrition, and Forestry of the Senate a report describing the activities carried out under the demonstration project during the preceding year.

subparagraph.text: There is authorized to be appropriated to the Secretary to carry out this subsection $5,000,000, to remain available until expended.
With respect to any funds made available under subparagraph (A), only funds appropriated in advance specifically to carry out this subsection shall be available to carry out this subsection.

paragraph.text: The Secretary shall appoint an existing office of the Department of Agriculture to administer Tribal self-determination contracts, including—

subparagraph.text: awarding of FNS nutrition program self-determination contracts to selected Tribal entities; and
hiring contract officers and program staff in order to manage the selection of Tribal entities and execution of self-determination contracts.

paragraph.text: Notwithstanding any other provision of law, there is authorized to be appropriated to the Secretary $1,200,000 for each of fiscal years 2026 through 2029 for the payment of Department contract officers and program staff salaries and benefits.
